messageBody:
Hi Everyone,

I've been using jUnit with great success.  However, Keith's recent comment
brings up a question that's been on my mind for awhile:

> Date: Fri, 5 Jan 2001 15:02:18 -0800
> From: Keith Ray <keith.ray@...>

> What you are doing sounds like acceptance testing. Unit testing with JUnit
> is intended to QUICKLY show that all tests pass while you are refactoring,
> or that only one test fails when you are writing test-first code.
>
> Acceptance testing usually tests that the application satisfies the user's
> Stories... failures are allowed (and expected) for un-implemented stories.
> Kent Beck describes the results of Acceptance testing to be a number like
> "89% of tests pass".

It's clear that jUnit isn't complete support for XP-ish functional testing.
That requires something that can track pass rates over time, make sure
previously-passing tests don't start failing, maybe print some reports for
the Customer to review...

So what tools are people using to support functional testing?

Cheers,
.T.

Todd Jonker
ZEFER Pittsburgh
